meanings.definition: A muscle that closes an opening, such as the obturator externus muscle.
meanings.sent1: The obturator helps close the gap tightly.
meanings.sent2: Doctors study the obturator muscle in the body.
meanings.sent3: The obturator muscle decided to take a break from closing.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was like that of an obturator muscle, sealing off any doubts.
meanings.sent5: The obturator muscle acts like a gatekeeper, shutting out unwanted visitors.

meanings.definition: A surgical instrument used to close a natural orifice, such as the obturator foramen.
meanings.sent1: The surgeon used the obturator to seal the opening.
meanings.sent2: Hospitals keep various obturators for different procedures.
meanings.sent3: The obturator foramen tool decided to play hide and seek.
meanings.sent4: His words acted as an obturator, closing off any further discussion.
meanings.sent5: The obturator foramen tool worked like a key, locking the entrance securely.
